intro: Allosidastrum, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange ray flowers that resemble daisies, with a central disk of smaller florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, often in sandy or rocky soils. Allosidastrum species are often found in coastal areas or along roadsides, where they can tolerate saline and drought conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable component of local flora in its native habitats.
